title: Roasted Tomato Sauce
yield: Makes enough for 1 pound of pasta
introduction: Roasted Tomato Sauce is a versatile and flavorful addition to your culinary repertoire. Utilizing fresh tomatoes, this sauce can be made with a single variety or a mix, creating a rich and aromatic complement to any pasta or as a spread on toasted bread. Fresh herbs such as basil or parsley elevate the flavors, while the slow roasting process enhances the natural sweetness of the tomatoes.
ingredients: 2½ pounds round, plum, cherry, or grape tomatoes
½ cup chopped fresh basil, parsley, or other herbs
instructions: 1. Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400° F. Oil a 13 × 9 × 2–inch nonreactive baking pan.
2. Coarsely chop round or plum tomatoes into ½-inch pieces. Cut cherry or grape tomatoes into halves or quarters.
3. Spread the tomatoes in the pan. Sprinkle with the garlic, salt, and crushed red pepper. Drizzle with the oil and stir gently.
4. Roast 30 to 45 minutes or until the tomatoes are lightly browned. Remove the tomatoes from the oven and stir in the herbs. Serve hot or at room temperature.
